name: Needing help ASAP for rakaska form
author: stalkcasper

posts.author: stalkcasper
posts.content: I have redone this build quite a few times and I cannot seem to get rak shape. Could someone tell me all that i need to get rak form? Thank you so much!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
To get Rak shape, you need the Outsider shape feat.
That requirees an epic character with at least 10 levels of shifter and at least wisdom 25.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
All of the following are from the final release notes pdf for
Neverwinter Nights Enhanced Edition. These aren't everything,
but it is what I found more interesting & affects the gameplay most.

1) Assassins with Death Attack can now use
Improved Sneak Attack without having
Sneak Attack 1.
2) Assassin’s Death Attack paralysis length is based
only on assassin level, not total character level.
3) Assassin’s Death Attack balanced to only fire once
per round (first attack).
4) Fix to Uncanny Dodge 2 feat (higher-level rogues
are now allowed to attack lesser rogues with
Sneak/Death attacks)
5) Monk’s Circle Kick: When current target leaves
maximum attack range, we will now pick a new
target within attack range instead of standing and
doing nothing
6) Defensive Stance mode will be canceled properly
when casting a spell or using an item
7) Greater Sanctuary now stacks properly with
Invisibility (True Seeing no longer pierces both
effects)
8) Monk’s Stunning Fist: Balance change to last only
one round instead of three rounds
9) For feat-based spells (such as Harper Scout sleep),
GetSpellSaveDC now computed properly when
the base ability score for the character is
less than 10.
10) Extra spell slots earned from items are
unreadied instead of cleared when shapeshifting/polymorphing.
11) Removed ability for shapeshifting players to
abuse the UI and use their normal spells while
shapeshifted.

Hm, some nice fixes but some (unnecessary IMO) big nerfs too.
Assassins won't be happy.
Could not find anything for Rakshasas,
but It might be on some post-release patch.

Maybe I should post this somewhere else with its own topic, perhaps,
as more & more people appear that play the Enhanced Edition.
